## Query.openCursor() method

> This API is provided as a beta preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Opens a iterable cursor, with the cursor object it's possible to iterate one document after another

**Signature:**

```typescript
openCursor(query?: QueryRootFilter, options?: QueryOpenCursorOptions): this;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

query


</td><td>

QueryRootFilter


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Search query object


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[QueryOpenCursorOptions](./iodm-query.queryopencursoroptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Query options


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

this


## Example


```ts
const query = new Query(idb, "store-name");
const itr = await query.openCursor({ $key: "text", value: { $gte: 4 } });

for await (const doc of itr) {
  console.log(doc);
}
```
